column3: Also, the commit message here sucks. Please explain what it's supposed to do and why...\n

What I meant in #6393 was that when execution reaches the part of `AppInit2()` where the RPC server is unlocked (meaning `SetRPCWarmupFinished()` is called), the code has made sure that `chainActive.Tip()` is not null. It either has successfully indexed the genesis block, or exit with an error. See also #5243.\n\nThis means that checks (or assertions) for `chainActive.Tip()` are not necessary in t
Well,  as was pointed out in #6393 the `block &&` check is pointless given the immediate de-reference afterwards.\n
But it doesn't really hurt either. I see no reason for changing this code.\n
I don't know the context of this PR, but it seems to me this should just be block?block->nHeight:0\n
@luke-jr I think it won't always be `0` since `& BLOCK_HAVE_DATA` would fail for the first pruned block, hence,  the last "pruned" block.\n
In that case, block won't be NULL... (I assume you're familiar with the trinary operator?)\n
Do you mean the ternary operator?\n
And yes,  I understand the block won't be `NULL`... I'm not sure I understand what your point is? \n
